meanings.definition: The position or rank of a soldier.
meanings.sent1: In the army, achieving high officership is a goal for many soldiership.
meanings.sent2: His dedication and hard work earned him a promotion in the soldiership.
meanings.sent3: The soldiership of the general was so high that even the enemy respected him.
meanings.sent4: She reached the pinnacle of soldiership, leading her troops with unwavering determination.
meanings.sent5: The soldiership of the sergeant major was evident in the way he commanded respect from his unit.

meanings.definition: The qualities or characteristics of a soldier.
meanings.sent1: Bravery and loyalty are essential qualities in soldiership.
meanings.sent2: His strict discipline and courage exemplify true soldiership.
meanings.sent3: The soldiership of the young recruit was tested during his first battle.
meanings.sent4: Her soldiership shone through as she fearlessly faced the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The soldiership of the veteran was unmatched, inspiring those around him.

meanings.definition: The act of serving as a soldier.
meanings.sent1: His dedication to soldiership led him to enlist in the army.
meanings.sent2: Soldiership requires sacrifice and commitment to protect the nation.
meanings.sent3: The soldiership of the new cadet was put to the test during training.
meanings.sent4: She embraced soldiership wholeheartedly, ready to defend her country.
meanings.sent5: The soldiership of the troops was evident as they marched into battle with determination.
